summary: This is an email from an Assistant United States Attorney in the Southern District of New York forwarding three Touhy letters sent by the law firm Steptoe the previous week. The letters are addressed to the SDNY, the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC), and the FBI, with the FBI letter specifically addressed to Kelly Maguire.

persons.name: Kelly Maguire
persons.context: The FBI letter from Steptoe is addressed to Kelly Maguire, indicating they are an FBI point of contact.

events.title: Steptoe sends Touhy letters
events.description: The law firm Steptoe sent three Touhy letters (legal requests for testimony or records from federal employees) to the SDNY, MCC, and FBI.

keyFacts: Three Touhy letters were sent by the law firm Steptoe in August 2019 to the SDNY, MCC, and FBI.
The FBI letter was addressed to Kelly Maguire.
The correspondence occurred shortly after Jeffrey Epstein's death in August 2019, suggesting legal activity related to the investigation or its aftermath.
The email is from an Assistant United States Attorney in the SDNY, indicating federal prosecutors were involved in handling these requests.
Touhy letters are used to request testimony or documents from federal employees, implying efforts to gather information from government agencies.
